intro: Rosa rubiginosa f. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a compact shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, giving it the "tenuifolia" descriptor, meaning "thin leaf." It is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and hardy nature in garden settings.
